name: Johann Gottfried Tulla
text: Johann Gottfried Tulla (1770–1828) was a German engineer renowned for straightening the Upper Rhine River, significantly improving navigation and reducing flooding. His work transformed the river's course and had lasting impacts on regional engineering.

name: Wilhelm Jordan
text: Wilhelm Jordan (1842–1899) was a German geodesist and mathematician known for his contributions to geodetic science, including the adjustment of triangulation networks and the development of the Gauss–Jordan elimination method.

name: Johannes van Mierlo
text: Johannes van Mierlo (dates unknown) was a geodesist associated with the Geodetic Institute at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, contributing to advancements in geodetic research and education.

name: Günter Schmitt
text: Günter Schmitt is a German engineer and businessman, serving as the managing partner of Schmitt Gruppe, a company specializing in logistics and transportation services.

name: Matthias Haid
text: Matthias Haid (dates unknown) was a German geodesist recognized for his contributions to the field of geodesy in the 19th century.

name: Bernhard Heck
text: Bernhard Heck is a German geodesist and professor known for his work in geodetic science, particularly in the areas of satellite geodesy and geodetic networks.

name: Heinrich Lichte
text: Heinrich Lichte (dates unknown) was a German geodesist who made significant contributions to the field of geodesy.

name: Heinz Draheim
text: Heinz Draheim (dates unknown) was a German geodesist known for his work in geodetic science.

name: Eugen Kuntz
text: Eugen Kuntz (dates unknown) was a German cartographer and author of 'Kartennetzentwurfslehre: Grundlagen und Anwendungen,' contributing to the field of cartography.

name: Hermann Maelzer
text: Hermann Maelzer (dates unknown) was a German geodesist recognized for his contributions to geodetic science.

name: Hans-Georg Wenzel
text: Hans-Georg Wenzel (dates unknown) was a German geodesist known for his work in the field of geodesy.

name: Martin Näbauer
text: Martin Näbauer (dates unknown) was a German geodesist recognized for his contributions to geodetic science.

name: Adolf Schlötzer
text: Adolf Schlötzer (dates unknown) was a German geodesist who served at the Geodetic Institute of the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology from 1926 to 1952.

name: Heinrich Merkel
text: Heinrich Merkel (dates unknown) was a German geodesist affiliated with the Geodetic Institute at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology from 1938 to 1960.
